snippet.textDisplay: Darksiders 1 and 2 were brilliant game. When Darksiders 3 was announced i got hyped, hoping this new studio would do well but to say i was disappointed would be an understatement.... Who else wants the original team to make a Darksiders 3 and 4 to finish the four horsemen?
snippet.textOriginal: Darksiders 1 and 2 were brilliant game. When Darksiders 3 was announced i got hyped, hoping this new studio would do well but to say i was disappointed would be an understatement.... Who else wants the original team to make a Darksiders 3 and 4 to finish the four horsemen?

snippet.textDisplay:
To be honest, I was really disappointed as well.
I wish it would happen, but sadly, the original team (Vigil Games) got shut down in 2013. 
However, there's still a beacon of hope since there's a new company whose founding members are also the founding members of Vigil Games, who are currently making Darksiders Genesis, which actually looks like a promising spin-off.
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: @Isaac Clyde [PSN: Nightmare-Grand] All I can say to that is; Warmastered is a great remaster. Definitely worth getting.
snippet.textOriginal: @Isaac Clyde [PSN: Nightmare-Grand] All I can say to that is; Warmastered is a great remaster. Definitely worth getting.

snippet.textDisplay:
@Isaac Clyde [PSN: Nightmare-Grand] Yeah it is. It should be up there with God of War and such as a game series, if only because of DS2.

So glad I pre ordered the Blades & Whips edition for DS3. I got the DS1 Warmastered and DS2 Deathinitive editions alongside it, plus I'm happy to support the devs. Now I can enjoy the DS2 remaster whenever I like, and honestly, it remains one of the best games ever made even seven years later. Thanks to its unique artsyle, it is timeless.
snippet.textOriginal:
@Isaac Clyde [PSN: Nightmare-Grand] Yeah it is. It should be up there with God of War and such as a game series, if only because of DS2.

snippet.textDisplay:
@Straight White Male I agree...
honestly, just talking about this really makes me want to replay the game again, it's just phenomenal. And it's also quite sad to see how *underrated* this invaluable gem is.
snippet.textOriginal:
@Straight White Male I agree...
honestly, just talking about this really makes me want to replay the game again, it's just phenomenal. And it's also quite sad to see how *underrated* this invaluable gem is.

snippet.textDisplay:
@Isaac Clyde [PSN: Nightmare-Grand] We have the exact same thoughts on it. Yeah DS2 is just about my favorite game of all time, tied with Dark Souls 3. I can't really add to what you said. It describes it pretty damn well.

I'll never forget the feeling of The Forgelands, or entering The Ivory Citadel for the first time. That music alone was just so stellar, and then the combat... Straight up 10/10.
snippet.textOriginal:
@Isaac Clyde [PSN: Nightmare-Grand] We have the exact same thoughts on it. Yeah DS2 is just about my favorite game of all time, tied with Dark Souls 3. I can't really add to what you said. It describes it pretty damn well.

I'll never forget the feeling of The Forgelands, or entering The Ivory Citadel for the first time. That music alone was just so stellar, and then the combat... Straight up 10/10.

snippet.textDisplay:
@Straight White Male Darksiders 2 is next to impossible to top. The aesthetics, the game world, the gameplay (the combat is just the best!), the enemy / boss design, the diversity, not to forget the absolutely amazing soundtrack... 
It is in my top 3 favorite games ever made, along with Red Dead Redemption 2 and LittleBigPlanet 2.
While DS3 was not bad, it just didn't manage to hold water to DS2. The boss design was creative, but I really didn't like Fury (in contrast, I *love* Death), and the gameplay seriously lacked diversity imo, and the soundtrack was very forgettable. 
I still enjoyed it, don't get me wrong, but DS2 will forever occupy the throne of my favorite games.
snippet.textOriginal:
@Straight White Male Darksiders 2 is next to impossible to top. The aesthetics, the game world, the gameplay (the combat is just the best!), the enemy / boss design, the diversity, not to forget the absolutely amazing soundtrack... 
It is in my top 3 favorite games ever made, along with Red Dead Redemption 2 and LittleBigPlanet 2.
While DS3 was not bad, it just didn't manage to hold water to DS2. The boss design was creative, but I really didn't like Fury (in contrast, I *love* Death), and the gameplay seriously lacked diversity imo, and the soundtrack was very forgettable. 
I still enjoyed it, don't get me wrong, but DS2 will forever occupy the throne of my favorite games.

snippet.textDisplay: @Janine Brennan Well THQ went bankrupt. The game sold well, but not to their expectations. They basically had the entire fate of the company riding on this game. A profit, but not the 4 million copy profit they needed. Still, THQ Nordic has the rights now, and the name is rather self-explanatory. Many of the previous game developers are on the team. Still, I doubt they'll ever top D2.
snippet.textOriginal: @Janine Brennan Well THQ went bankrupt. The game sold well, but not to their expectations. They basically had the entire fate of the company riding on this game. A profit, but not the 4 million copy profit they needed. Still, THQ Nordic has the rights now, and the name is rather self-explanatory. Many of the previous game developers are on the team. Still, I doubt they'll ever top D2.

snippet.textDisplay:
It's not always a bad thing. Like I said, the bigger reason is #2. That said, it's also a nitpick pet peeve of mine. I don't mind getting ideas and then melding them into your own play style, but from what I played of the first(roughly 5 hours)it copied others almost to a point of video game plagarism. At least it felt that way to me.
At least I can happily say though unlike certain games, when this one derives from others, it takes the good points.
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay:
Seems like it has a lot of good going for it, though I must say it's hard for me to get into for 2 reasons.
1.) There's no denying it gets an insane amount of ideas from other games gameplay wise.
2.) The bigger reason, I have one of those "friends"(person who hangs out with you despite no one inviting) whom once he likes a game, he never stops talking about it, to the point you actually start to dislike it simply because it makes you think of your "friend", who is obsessed with these.
